extendedInfo.description: OverviewinPractice provides insight and practical recommendations for the care of patients with cancer.Subject Matter: Solid Tumors and Hematologic MalignanciesDesigned forPhysicians and other healthcare professionals including:â¢	Oncology and hematology specialistsâ¢	Residents/fellowsâ¢	Other specialists managing patients with solid tumors or hematologic malignancies â¢	Nurses, nurse practitioners, and physician assistants caring for patients with solid tumors or hematologic malignanciesâ¢	Primary care practitioners managing patients with solid tumors or hematologic malignancies Key Components â¢	Expert-authored, comprehensive oncology/hematology reference workâ¢	Continuously updated to incorporate latest findings and best practicesâ¢	Complete drug database (by Lexi-Comp; includes all FDA-approved drugs)â¢	National and international guidelinesâ¢	Relevant PubMed abstracts (MEDLINE)â¢	ClinicalTrials.govIn PracticeâNot Just in TheoryTranslates the constant stream of the latest developments in oncology/hematology into clinically applicable information.â¢	Search and find practical recommendations for your patient care questionsâ¢	Know that the evidence supports your decisionsEfficiently CurrentIntegrates insightful Conference Coverage, drug developments, journal citations, and guidelines to keep you abreast of the developments you can apply to practice. Education With RelevanceEarn CME credit for the topics youâre searching anyway. (To claim credit, just visit the free, companion Web site.)Additional Features	â¢	Easily share information with colleagues or traineesâ¢	Integrated bookmark function for quick return access to key topicsâ¢	Companion Web site includedHow to Gain Access:Free, one-time registration or use your existing Clinical Care Options member ID.
